TopicTitle: [WIP][1.6.x_TEMPORARY FIX] NAS - Naval Artillery System 0.7.0 (BDAc Addon, WW2 Naval Weapons) - "Land of Dragon" - 2018/4/28

Articles.Content:
Log:

After all day long discussions we finally decided to make the hull parts individual. It won't rely on Maritime Pack, but will function somehow like it.

Here we tribute to Fengist, all our group members like his work, and it is indeed a great part pack to make civilian ships. We'll do our best to make our own perfect.

Edited October 2, 2015 by Acea

Log:

Modeler Edoaca has been out with families all day, so it was Kerwis and Ladeng who did modeling today.

We've decided sizes of all hull parts, and made a brand new model for 38cm SK/C34. It works perfectly.

I'm not sure if we could finish the new mod before we go back to our own affairs, due to the amount of all those parts. We'll finish it though.

Edit:

I made the flag of Kerbin Navy:) This will be included in that heavily WIP hull pack, temporarily named as WDS.

Edited October 2, 2015 by Acea
Are you going to make smaller destroyer/submarine deck guns like the 4" 50 or the 88mm?

Are you going to make smaller destroyer/submarine deck guns like the 4" 50 or the 88mm?

Maybe who knows. In fact a QF 4.5" from Royal Navy is already complete, ready to release after next C.A.L update.

It seems that this project can be finished in time, we just need to cooperate and communicate with each other better.

Practical question: how will the VLS cells operate independently when launching missiles? In other words, say its tied into the weapons manager (not to say it is, I'm just spitballing here), how, or will, it not simply open all tubes when one is launched?

largest missile is the RIM-174 all my weapons are built to real world size

also ill have to get you that C.A.L update tomorrow things got a bit out of hand today

Practical question: how will the VLS cells operate independently when launching missiles? In other words, say its tied into the weapons manager (not to say it is, I'm just spitballing here), how, or will, it not simply open all tubes when one is launched?

They simply open and close together, no such complex mechanics and actions.

Log:

Testing VLS, with RIM-162 from P.E.W by LORDPrometheus.

Animation works well, but the cells seem too shallow in this part, you'll need a size larger than realistic US destroyers to actually fit an RIM-174 in. Since it'll take some time to make a new one, a version with deeper cells would come later.
But can the RIM-162s be quad packed?

But can the RIM-162s be quad packed?

You can use action groups or ask Prometheus. I'm just making a silo to fit these in, not making these stuffs work better or more efficiently.

You can use action groups or ask Prometheus. I'm just making a silo to fit these in, not making these stuffs work better or more efficiently.

I was actually just talking about physical space

I was actually just talking about physical space

Holding four RIM-162s in one cell is possible, I tried just now

Holding four RIM-162s in one cell is possible, I tried just now

Awesome

Glad to see the progress im back from my weekend break and am working on bugfixing now

- - - Updated - - -

Also I think the RIM-174 is supposed to fit maybe I need to check my scaling

- - - Updated - - -

What are the dimensions of the cell?

Log:

Our progress slows down. It has been a hard day to me, as I was balancing the modular armor plates in game.

That's not easy, due to the heat damage codes of BDArmory, which predicts that with no ablation, a target being hit by a 46 cm round at zero distance without penetration would experience a rising temperature of 47450 K... Anything behind that would be totally vaporized in real world, just like being hit by a nuke.

After all we'll deal with it in Kerbalalike ways.

- - - Updated - - -

What are the dimensions of the cell?

Original size of the cell, limited by size of basic blocks, is 0.725*0.725*2.45, and can be scaled up to 4x.

We'll surely make a deeper and more integrated VLS block in a later version, but now all of us are trying to fight against BDArmory damage rules.

Edited October 5, 2015 by Acea
Excellent, now I can make a pointlessly large Ratte-oid with a pointlessly large gun.

Log:

Yesterday Ladeng went to school, and I was helping another modding group with their modern naval guns. The next NAS update will come to the surface in a day or two, and here's a preview above.

For that hull part pack, we agreed to halt it up until 1.0.5 release, since NathanKell's work on thermal tweaks may influence defending effects.

Edited October 7, 2015 by Acea
